intro: Phyllanthus guanxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has a short stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological and medicinal significance.
